snippet: After the U.S. spent hundreds of millions of dollars and deployed nearly 3,000 troops, only 28 Ebola patients have been treated at the 11 centers built by the American military in Liberia.
abstract: Eleven mostly-empty Ebola treatment centers set up by the United States in Liberia at peak of epidemic are testament to unpredictability of disease and shortcomings in international response to epidemic; only 28 patients were treated in centers, nine of which remain unused; health officials are examining response to epidemic in order to pinpoint successes and shortcomings for future efforts.
lead_paragraph: After the U.S. spent hundreds of millions of dollars and deployed nearly 3,000 troops, only 28 Ebola patients have been treated at the 11 centers built by the American military in Liberia.

headline.main: Empty Ebola Clinics in Liberia Are Seen as Misstep in U.S. Relief Effort
headline.print_headline: Empty Clinics Called Misstep in Ebola Effort

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
